title: 14-Week Comprehensive AI PM Roadmap
goal: Land a FAANG/Top-tier AI PM role by February 23, 2026

profile.description: Technical PM (4 years) with engineering background

coreSkills.description: LLM fundamentals, RAG, Fine-tuning, Embeddings, Vector DBs, and Classical ML (Supervised/Unsupervised).
Scalable architecture, Data pipelines, Cloud services (AWS/GCP), Cost optimization, Latency/quality trade-offs.
User interviews, Usability testing, UX for hallucinations/latency, Ethical constraints, User-centered AI design.
Market analysis, GTM strategy, Pricing, Roadmapping, PRDs, Leadership presentations, Cross-functional alignment.
North Star metrics, RICE, A/B testing for AI, Analytics logging plans, SQL-based insights.
Identifying and mitigating bias, fairness, 'red teaming', model cards, data privacy, building user trust.
Mock interviews (All types), STAR stories, Strategic networking, Resume/Portfolio optimization, Application execution.

phases.title: BUILD AI PRODUCT & PM FOUNDATION
phases.summary: Master AI/ML fundamentals, system design, and core PM documentation through hands-on projects.

weeks.title: AI Fundamentals & First Product Build
weeks.theme: "Build to Learn" - Create your first AI product while learning fundamentals

buildSection.description: Build a ChatGPT-style interface for a specific domain. Implement conversation memory. Deploy to Vercel.
technicalStack: LLM: OpenAI GPT-4 or Claude 3.5 Sonnet

deliverables.description: 1-Page Product Brief for this idea (defining user, problem, and solution)

deepDiveTopics.description: LLM architecture & how transformers work (2h)

suggestedResources.title: Andrej Karpathy's "Intro to Large Language Models" (YouTube)

subtasks.description: Read "Attention Is All You Need" paper summary

suggestedResources.title: Attention Is All You Need - Paper
The Transformer Family by Lilian Weng

deepDiveTopics.description: Prompt engineering best practices (2h)

resources.title: Andrej Karpathy's "Intro to Large Language Models" (YouTube)

shareSection.artifactDescription: LinkedIn post: "Built my first AI product assistant in 2 days - here's what I learned about LLMs"
details: Include: Demo video, key insights, technical challenges

weeks.title: System Design & MLOps
weeks.theme: "Scale It" - Design systems for millions of users and robust data pipelines

buildSection.projectTitle: System Design for AI Chat Platform
buildSection.description: Design architecture for 1M+ concurrent users. Create detailed diagrams. Calculate costs. Design data pipeline for training/fine-tuning.
components: Caching strategy (Redis) to reduce LLM calls

deliverables.description: Data flow diagram for model training (ingestion to serving)
Trade-offs document (latency vs. cost vs. quality)

deepDiveTopics.description: Grokking the System Design Interview (AI-specific chapters)

suggestedResources.title: Grokking the System Design Interview - Book
Designing Machine Learning Systems Book by Chip Huyen

deepDiveTopics.description: MLOps Principles (2h)

suggestedResources.title: MLOps: Continuous delivery and automation pipelines in ML

deepDiveTopics.description: Study real architectures (ChatGPT, Perplexity.ai, Notion AI)

suggestedResources.title: Perplexity AI Architecture - Building a Modern Search Engine
How Notion AI Works - Engineering Blog

deepDiveTopics.description: AWS/GCP AI services comparison (SageMaker vs. Vertex AI)

suggestedResources.title: AWS vs GCP for Machine Learning - Comparison

shareSection.artifactDescription: "How to Design AI Products for 1M+ Users: Cost, Latency, and MLOps"
details: Share cost analysis and MLOps insights

weeks.title: Advanced AI Capabilities & Classical ML
weeks.theme: "Go Beyond Chat" - Implement RAG and review classical ML foundations

buildSection.description: Build a product that answers questions from your custom knowledge base. Implement RAG with vector embeddings. Compare against vanilla LLM responses.

deepDiveTopics.description: RAG architectures & best practices (2h)
Fine-tuning vs. RAG trade-offs (2h)

suggestedResources.title: Fine-tuning vs RAG: When to Use Each
RAG vs Fine-tuning: Choosing the Right Approach
When to Use RAG vs Fine-tuning

deepDiveTopics.description: Classical ML Foundations (2h)

suggestedResources.title: Introduction to Machine Learning - Stanford CS229

subtasks.description: How recommendation systems work (collaborative vs. content-based)

shareSection.artifactDescription: "RAG vs. Fine-tuning: A PM's Guide to Customizing LLMs"

weeks.title: Product Strategy & PM Artifacts
weeks.theme: "Think Like a PM" - Strategy, prioritization, ethics, and engineering comms

buildSection.description: Choose one of your products. Create comprehensive strategy doc. Then, write a detailed PRD for the *next major feature* (which you will build in Week 5).

deliverables.description: Strategy document (8-10 pages) (Market analysis, Personas, Vision, Roadmap, North Star, Pricing)
Product Requirements Doc (PRD) for Flagship Project (User Stories, Acceptance Criteria, Scope, Analytics hooks)
Responsible AI & Ethics Brief (1-page) for your product

deepDiveTopics.description: AI product teardowns (4h) (ChatGPT, Claude, Perplexity, Jasper)
Responsible AI Frameworks (2h) (Google's AI Principles, Model Cards)
How to write effective PRDs (2h) (Study examples from Lenny's Newsletter, Atlassian)

suggestedResources.title: How to Write a PRD - Lenny's Newsletter

resources.title: Lenny's Podcast episodes on AI PMs
a16z articles on AI product-market fit

shareSection.artifactDescription: "From 1-Pager to PRD: My Process for Scoping an AI Product"
details: Include your (abbreviated) PRD template and strategic insights

phases.title: SIGNATURE PROJECT & CORE PM EXECUTION
phases.summary: Build a flagship product while executing on the core PM competencies: user research, data analysis, strategy, and stakeholder communication.

weeks.title: Flagship Product Build & AI UX
weeks.theme: "Ship v1.0" - Build your portfolio centerpiece based on your PRD

buildSection.description: Build the product defined in your Week 4 PRD. Focus on production quality, user auth, and deliberate AI-UX (handling latency, errors, and trust).

deliverables.description: Product demo video (2-3 min) highlighting AI-UX features

deepDiveTopics.description: Study Google's People + AI Guidebook
Research pricing strategies for AI (token-based vs. user-based)

suggestedResources.title: AI Pricing Strategies for AI Apps
Unit Economics for AI SaaS Companies
AI Pricing Models Explained: From Tokens to Seats

shareSection.artifactDescription: "I built [Product Name]... here's how I designed the UX for AI (hallucinations, latency, and all)"
details: Include: Demo video, tech decisions, AI-UX screenshots

weeks.title: Customer Discovery & AI Usability
weeks.theme: "Talk to Users" - Go beyond building and actively seek customer feedback

buildSection.description: Create the documents needed to run professional user research for your flagship product.

deliverables.description: Usability Test Plan (for your v1.0 product)

deepDiveTopics.description: Conduct 5 mock user interviews (with peers, friends) using your script
Conduct 3 mock usability tests on your v1.0 product
Fill out your Synthesis Report with real findings
Read 'The Mom Test' (summary or book)

suggestedResources.title: The Mom Test by Rob Fitzpatrick
Nielsen Norman Group - Usability Testing Articles

resources.title: NN/g (Nielsen Norman Group) articles on usability testing

shareSection.artifactDescription: "I user-tested my AI product with 5 people. Here's what I learned about AI-UX (and my own bad assumptions)."
details: Share 3 key insights from your synthesis report

weeks.title: Data, Analytics & Experimentation
weeks.theme: "Measure What Matters" - Define how to measure success for your AI product

buildSection.description: Define the data infrastructure and experimentation framework for your flagship product.

deliverables.description: Analytics & Logging Plan (Define key events, properties, and funnels)
A/B Test Plan for a new AI feature (Hypothesis, Primary/Counter Metrics, Rollout)
SQL queries to answer 3 key product questions (using mock schema)

deepDiveTopics.description: Deep dive on SQL (e.g., Mode's SQL tutorial)
Study A/B testing for AI (Statsig/Optimizely blogs)
Implement PostHog/Mixpanel and track your defined events in your v1.0 product

resources.title: Statsig blogs on AI A/B testing

shareSection.artifactDescription: "How to Define Metrics and A/B Tests for Generative AI Products"
details: Share your A/B test plan template

weeks.title: Strategy, GTM & Stakeholder Comms
weeks.theme: "Align the Organization" - Create the artifacts to get buy-in and launch

buildSection.description: Create the high-level strategy and communication documents for your flagship product.

deliverables.description: 5-Slide Leadership 'Go/No-Go' Deck (Problem, Solution, GTM, Metrics, Ask)
Stakeholder Update Email Template (for Engineering, Marketing, Leadership)

deepDiveTopics.description: Analyze GTM & pricing of 3 competitors (4h)
Read 'Crossing the Chasm' (summary or book) (2h)

suggestedResources.title: Crossing the Chasm by Geoffrey A. Moore

deepDiveTopics.description: Study Strategic Storytelling (how to present to execs) (2h)

suggestedResources.title: Sequoia Capital's Guide to Writing a Business Plan
How to Present to Executives - Harvard Business Review

resources.title: 'Crossing the Chasm' by Geoffrey A. Moore
Sequoia Capital's guide to writing a business plan

shareSection.artifactDescription: "I created a GTM plan and Leadership deck for my AI product. Here's the 5-slide structure I used to justify the launch."
details: Share the 5 slide titles and their purpose

weeks.title: Portfolio & Brand Consolidation
weeks.theme: "Become Visible" - Consolidate all new artifacts into a world-class portfolio

buildSection.description: Build your professional portfolio site (Webflow, Framer, Next.js). This is now your #1 asset.

deliverables.description: Live portfolio website with public URL
Case Study 1: Flagship Product (show demo, PRD, GTM deck, User Research insights)
Case Study 2: RAG Product (show demo, system design, eval metrics)
Case Study 3: AI Product Assistant (show demo, 1-pager)
Updated LinkedIn profile to point to new portfolio

deepDiveTopics.description: Study 5-10 portfolios of top PMs (2h)
Research AI PM communities (2h) (Product School, Mind the Product, AI PM Discord)

shareSection.artifactDescription: Launch portfolio website publicly. Announce on LinkedIn with retrospective post. Engage with 20+ AI PM posts this week. DM 5 AI PMs for feedback on your portfolio.

phases.title: INTERVIEW PREP & CAREER LAUNCH
phases.summary: Execute strategic networking, optimize application materials, and nail mock interviews covering the full breadth of PM skills.

weeks.title: Mock Interviews: Product & Tech
weeks.theme: "Perfect Your Performance" - Product Sense & System Design

buildSection.description: Create reusable templates and practice answers for Product & Tech loops.

deliverables.description: 1-page framework for AI ethics & bias questions
1-page framework for A/B test & metrics questions

deepDiveTopics.description: Schedule 3 mock interviews (1.5h each)
Record each mock interview and get detailed feedback

suggestedResources.title: How to Get Better Interview Feedback

deepDiveTopics.description: Create improvement plan based on feedback

shareSection.artifactDescription: "Just finished 3 AI PM mock interviews. Here's the #1 mistake I was making in the Product Sense loop."

weeks.title: Mock Interviews: Behavioral & Strategy
weeks.theme: "Perfect Your Performance" - STAR Stories & Stakeholder Qs

buildSection.description: Write out your STAR stories, focusing on the new PM skills you've built.

subtasks.description: Stories for: Stakeholder conflict, Influencing eng, Handling ambiguity, Failure, User empathy, Data-driven decision

deepDiveTopics.description: Schedule 2 mock interviews (1.5h each)
Refine STAR stories based on mock feedback

suggestedResources.title: How to Craft Powerful STAR Stories

shareSection.artifactDescription: "How I'm using my 4 portfolio projects to create 20+ STAR interview stories."

buildSection.description: 1. Target Companies Research (4h) - List 30 companies. 2. LinkedIn Outreach (7h) - Identify 50 people. 3. Cold Email Campaign (3h) - Send 20 emails.

deepDiveTopics.description: Conduct 4-5 coffee chats (30 min each)

suggestedResources.title: How to Network Effectively - Product School

deepDiveTopics.description: Ask: AI PM role, valuable skills, interview process, referrals, challenges

shareSection.artifactDescription: Post 3 times this week on LinkedIn. Engage with your network's content daily.
details: Topic: "What I learned from networking with 20 AI PMs"
Topic: "My AI PM portfolio [showcase your work]"

buildSection.description: Create all materials and apply to Tier 1 roles.

deliverables.description: 3 Cover letter templates (FAANG, AI-first startup, Traditional tech)
Apply to 15 Tier-1 roles (Dream jobs, max customization)

deepDiveTopics.description: Company-Specific Prep for Tier-1 (5h)

subtasks.description: Research product launches, culture, interview questions

shareSection.artifactDescription: Focus on applications, not public sharing.

weeks.title: Final Prep, Follow-ups & Wave 2
weeks.theme: "Maintain Momentum" - Interviews, follow-ups, and expanding the search

buildSection.description: Apply to Tier 2/3 roles and handle follow-ups.

deliverables.description: Send follow-up emails for Wave 1 applications

deepDiveTopics.description: Practice Sessions (3h)

suggestedResources.title: How to Answer 'Tell Me About Yourself' - Product Manager

subtasks.description: Self-record answering 'Tell me about yourself' and 'Why AI PM?'

suggestedResources.title: Tell Me About Yourself - Product Manager Template

subtasks.description: Practice with a peer one more time (focus on weakest area)

deepDiveTopics.description: First-round interview prep (if scheduled)

shareSection.artifactDescription: Share your 14-week journey on LinkedIn. This builds social proof and visibility right as recruiters are viewing your profile.
details: Include: What you built, what you learned, key artifacts
Announce you are 'officially on the market for an AI PM role'

weeklyTimeAllocationTemplate.monTue: BUILD Days: 8-10 hours - Hands-on coding/product work, System design, Creating artifacts (PRDs, Decks)
weeklyTimeAllocationTemplate.wedThu: RESEARCH Days: 6-8 hours - Deep dives, User research, Competitive analysis, Interview prep
weeklyTimeAllocationTemplate.friSat: SHARE Days: 4-6 hours - Writing posts/articles, Creating demo videos, Portfolio updates, Networking
weeklyTimeAllocationTemplate.sun: REFLECT Day: 2-3 hours - Review week's progress, Plan next week, Adjust roadmap

metrics.description: PM Artifacts completed (PRD, GTM Deck, Strategy Doc, etc.)
Ethics briefs & A/B test plans completed
Concepts mastered (Classical ML, GTM, Stakeholder Comms)

items.name: Coursera
items.description: Duke AI for PM, Andrew Ng ML Course

items.name: DeepLearning.AI
items.description: Short courses on LLMs, RAG, fine-tuning

interviewBank.notes: AI-Specific: Value prop, Hallucination UX, Cold start, Quality measurement, Data privacy, Trust/latency UX
questions: Design an AI product for elderly care
How would you improve Google Docs with AI?
Design an AI coding assistant for non-technical PMs
Create an AI feature for Spotify
Design a UI to build user trust with an AI that is 70% confident

interviewBank.notes: Focus on how you get from 0 to 1 on a user problem.
questions: How would you decide *what* AI feature to build for LinkedIn?
Walk me through your user research process for [Your Portfolio Project]
A user complains your AI gave them bad advice. What do you do?
How do you design for AI errors (hallucinations)?

interviewBank.notes: Key Topics: Load balancing, Caching, Vector DBs, Model selection (hosted vs. self-hosted), Cost optimization, MLOps, A/B infra
questions: Design a system for AI-powered email assistant serving 10M users
How would you build a ChatGPT competitor?
Design the backend for Grammarly's AI features
Design a data pipeline for training a customer support AI

interviewBank.framework: RICE, OKRs, North Star. Key Metrics: Engagement, Quality (accuracy, hallucination rate), Efficiency (cost/query, latency), Business (conversion, LTV)
questions: How would you prioritize features for a new AI product?
Define success metrics for an AI writing assistant
Your AI product has 40% retention. Root cause?
You've launched a new AI model. Engagement is up, but retention is down. What do you do?
Our LLM costs are 10x projections. What do you do?

interviewBank.notes: AI PM-Specific: Explaining AI to non-technical stakeholders, Handling user trust, Ethical decisions
questions: Tell me about a time you influenced engineering without authority
Describe a situation where you had to make a decision with incomplete data
Tell me about a product failure and what you learned
Give an example of managing stakeholder conflict (e.g., Legal vs. Product)
Walk me through your PRD for [Your Portfolio Project]. How did you get buy-in from Eng?
How would you explain a complex AI concept (like RAG) to a marketing leader?
Should Google build a ChatGPT competitor? Why or why not?
How big is the market for AI code assistants?
What's your GTM strategy for [Your Portfolio Project]?
How would you compete with ChatGPT in the enterprise market?
How would you price an AI product (token vs. seat vs. value)?

weeklyRituals.daily: Morning: Review daily goals, check LinkedIn/AI news. Evening: Log progress, update task list, engage on LinkedIn
weeklyRituals.weekly: Sunday Planning: Review past week, plan next week, adjust roadmap. Friday Reflection: Write down learnings, update portfolio, schedule next week's shares
weeklyRituals.biWeekly: Portfolio Review: Get feedback from peers, iterate. Network Check-in: Reach out to 3-5 connections

items: Can you design a system for 1M users?
Have you written your first PRD?
Do you have 2+ public LinkedIn posts with engagement?
redFlagsAndAdjustments.adjustment: If No: Double down on building & PM artifacts, reduce research time

items: Do you have a live portfolio website with all PM artifacts (PRD, GTM, etc.)?
Have you completed your user research and data analysis plans?
Can you explain your GTM strategy confidently?
redFlagsAndAdjustments.adjustment: If No: Delay interview prep week, spend Week 10 on portfolio/brand

items: Have you completed 5+ mock interviews (all types)?
Do you have 5+ referrals or strong connections?
Is your STAR story bank complete?
redFlagsAndAdjustments.adjustment: If No: Extend mock interview/networking phase, delay application sprint

competitiveAdvantages.description: 2 years as engineer + Spring Boot → You can talk to engineers credibly

leverage.inInterviews: "As a former engineer, I wrote the PRD for my project with clear user stories and technical acceptance criteria. This helps build trust and velocity with the eng team."
leverage.inNetworking: "I'm building my AI PM expertise in public - here's my portfolio of 4 AI products I've shipped... but more importantly, here's the GTM deck and user research I did for them."

competitiveAdvantages.description: 4 years as PM → You understand product lifecycle, stakeholder management
Exploratory style → You can learn AI/ML faster than pure business PMs
You ship → Portfolio will demonstrate real capability, not just theory

leverage.inInterviews: "Here's the GTM deck I built for my flagship product. Let me walk you through my analysis."

competitiveAdvantages.description: Share journey → Builds brand while you learn

leverage.inNetworking: Share your learning journey on LinkedIn → Shows growth mindset

supplementalSections.finalMotivation: You have 14 weeks. That's ~300-350 hours of focused work. This is the 'no-shortcut' plan. It's designed to not just make you *look* like a top AI PM in an interview, but to give you the portfolio and deep-seated skills to *be* one from day one. By February 2026, you will have a portfolio that few can match, demonstrating end-to-end execution from technical build to user research to GTM strategy. This is achievable. This is YOUR roadmap. Let's execute. 🚀
nextSteps: Today: Review this 14-week roadmap. This is a significant commitment.
This Week: Start Week 1, build your first product AND your first 1-pager.
Every Sunday: Review progress, adjust if needed
February 23, 2026: Celebrate your new AI PM role
